title: Poland: Farm protests on the border with Germany and Ukraine.- Polonia: Farmers' protests on the border with Germany and Ukraine
content:
As of today, Polish farmers have been blocking important points on the German-Polish border on the A12. The blockade should take 24 hours, parts of the highway are closed to cars and trucks. The protest is directed against EU agricultural policy.

From today at noon, Polish farmers block important points on the German-Polish border in the A12. The blockade is expected to last 24 hours, with parts of the road closed to cars and trucks. The protest is directed against the EU agricultural policy.

Those: https://www.tagesschau.de/ausland/europa/polen-bauern-blockade-grenzuebergang-100.html

Fuente: https://www.tagesschau.de/ausland/europa/polen-bauern-blockade-Grenzuebergang-100.html


Polish farmers blocked the motorway to Germany near the border near Frankfurt (Oder) on Sunday. The farmers originally announced a four -week protest. After placement talks with Mariusz Olejniczak, the independent mayor of Słubice, only a warning strike should take place in which 500 to 700 vehicles participate. About 17,000 trucks pass the border crossing daily, the effects on traffic could extend to the outskirts of Berlin.

This protest is just one of many protests , which have been organized by the Polish farmers in recent months and is involved in the wave of peasant protests that are from imperialist countries like Germany, Spain Or France ranges to the semi -colonial and semi -footed countries. The protests in Poland are directed against the European Union's agricultural policy, especially against that Ukrainian farmers have been importing their grain duty -free since 2022 and this is sold for little money.

So there were protests on the border with Ukraine in the past week, for example on Medyka border crossing . In some actions was Not just the street , But also blocked train rails, tires and Ukrainian grain lit and lazy eggs thrown. Tractors were also protested in large cities, such as Gdansk and Krakow. According to Polish media reports, it has it throughout the country Over 250 blockages given.




Polish farmers blocked the highway with Germany near the border near Frankfurt (Oder) on Sunday. Farmers had initially announced a four -week protest. After a mediation with the independent mayor of Słubice, Mariusz Olejniczak, now only one warning strike will be held, in which between 500 and 700 vehicles will participate. Every day about 17,000 trucks go through the border crossing and the impact on traffic could extend to the outskirts of Berlin.



This protest is only one of the many organized by Polish farmers in recent months and adds to the wave of peasant protests ranging from imperialist countries such as Germany, Spain or France to semicolonial and semi -feudal countries. The protests in Poland are directed against the agricultural policy of the European Union, particularly against the fact that Ukrainian farmers import (or export (to the EU)? Translation note) their tax -free cereals since 2022 and are sold by Little money.



Last week there were also protests at the border with Ukraine, for example in the medyka border crossing. In some actions, not only the roads were blocked but also the train tracks, Ukrainian tires and cereals were burned and rotten eggs were thrown. Tractors were also used to protest in large cities, such as Gdansk and Krakow. According to Poles media reports, there have been more than 250 blockages throughout the country.

​


Those: https://www.berliner-zeitung.de/politik-gesellschaft/bauernproteste-in-polen-und-tschechien-weiten-sich-aus-eu-und-ukraine-in-der-kritik-li.2188932


Fuente: https://www.berliner-zeitung.de/politik-gesellschaft/bauernproteste-in-polen-und-tschechien-weiten-sich-aus-eu-und-ukraine-in-der-kritik-li.2188932



Rail blockade in Medyka, Poland. Source: Radio Svoboda on X

Like the revolutionary website „The Red Herald“ reported, the peasants from the Polish Prime Minister, Donald Tusk, demand that Poland from the so -called "Green New Deal", an agreement for the "EU climate neutrality by 2050" , it is decoupled, which, among other things, provides for the significant reduction of fertilizers and the rotation of cultures. They also called for the ban on Ukrainian grain in the EU.

The protests soon received criticism from the Ukrainian government. The Ukrainian Prime Minister Zelensky, loyal servant of imperialism, especially Yankee imperialism, did not take long to connect the protests of the Polish farmers to armed Russian attacks. Next Wednesday, February 28th Zelensky and Tusk hold a meeting , in which the Polish Prime Minister will try to maintain the support of the farmers and at the same time pursue the goals of the imperialists with the war, which includes the support of NATO and the import of materials across the land border.

Continue writes „The Red Herald“ In addition (our translation):

„ In the other Eastern European countries such as Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary, the Czech Republic And others, these demonstrations take place in a similar way in all countries. All have the same goal: to minimize the damage caused by the Ukrainian grain. Either through state aid or by banning the free traffic of Ukrainian grain.

However, all governments of these countries pursue the goals of imperialism, which means that they allow the massive import of Ukrainian products in favor of the monopolies and at the expense of the farmers of the country. […]

Many of the protests aim at the termination of agreements with semi -feudal and semi -colonial countries, which they classify as unfair, since the same environmental regulations do not apply to the farmers and farmers of the European Union, which leads to a price increase and a disadvantage in the competition. However, it is the European monopolis itself, especially German imperialism as a dominant power in the EU who take advantage of the war in Ukraine to enable the free traffic of the Ukrainian grain in the EU and thus prices for the grain under the pretext to reduce the "global nutritional security" because the Russian blockade of exports over the Black Sea took place at the beginning of the war. "


Rail block in Medyka, Poland. Source: Radio Svoboda in X



As reported by the revolutionary "The Red Herald" website, farmers demand that the Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk withdraw Poland from the so -called "Green New Deal", an agreement for "EU" climatic neutrality for 2050 ", which , among other things, it foresees for the significant reduction of fertilizers and crop rotation. They also requested the prohibition of Ukrainian grain in the EU.



The protests soon received criticism from the Ukrainian government. So it did not spend much time for Ukrainian Prime Minister Zelensky, a faithful server for imperialism, especially Yankee imperialism, to link the protests of Polish farmers with Russian armed attacks. Next Wednesday, February 28, Zelensky and Tusk will hold a meeting in which the Polish Prime Minister will try . through terrestrial borders.



“The Network Herald” is also written (DvD Translation of German):



“In the rest of Eastern European countries, such as Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary, Czech Republic and others, these demonstrations are being developing similarly in all countries. All have the same goal: minimize the damage caused by the Ukrainian grain. Either through state aid or prohibiting the free movement of Ukrainian cereals.


However, all the governments of these countries pursue the objectives of imperialism, which means that they allow the mass import of Ukrainian products for the benefit of monopolies and at the expense of the country's farmers. […]



Many of the protests aim to put an end to agreements with semi -feudal and semicolonial countries, which they consider unfair because they do not have the same environmental regulations as the farmers and farmers of the European Union, which causes an increase in prices and a competitive disadvantage . However, it is the European monopolies themselves, especially German imperialism as a dominant power in the EU, which are exploiting the war in Ukraine to allow the free circulation of the Ukrainian grain in the EU and thus increase the prices of the grain under the pretext of "Global Food Security" because the Russian blockade of exports through the Black Sea occurred at the beginning of the war. "

Written by Cadre
February 25, 2024
